intro: Claytonia parvifolia subsp. flagellaris, commonly known as the flagellar leaf springbeauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and rocky areas. Its unique leaf morphology and early blooming period make it a notable species in its native habitat.
